sn51.30:4.1: Then several mendicants went up to the Buddha …
sn51.30:4.3: “Mendicants, what is psychic power? What is the basis of psychic power? What is the development of the bases of psychic power? And what is the practice that leads to the development of the bases of psychic power?”
sn51.30:4.4: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. He is our guide and refuge. …”
sn51.30:5.2: It’s a mendicant who wields the many kinds of psychic power:
sn51.30:5.3: multiplying themselves and becoming one again …
sn51.30:5.4: controlling the body as far as the Brahmā realm.
sn51.30:6.1: And what is the basis of psychic power?
sn51.30:6.2: The path and practice that leads to gaining psychic power.
sn51.30:6.3: This is called the basis of psychic power.
sn51.30:7.1: And what is the development of the bases of psychic power?
sn51.30:7.2: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to enthusiasm … energy …
sn51.30:7.5: This is called the development of the bases of psychic power.
sn51.30:8.1: And what is the practice that leads to the development of the bases of psychic power?
sn51.30:8.2: It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
sn51.30:8.3: right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right samādhi.
sn51.30:8.5: This is called the practice that leads to the development of the bases of psychic power.”
